response: narrative=Jayne White, known to her neighbors and friends for her resilience despite chronic illness stress, vanished from her residence at 312 Greengairs Road, Greengairs. narrative=Jayne White was reported missing after failing to appear at her usual volunteer shelter shift near 37-39 York Place, Perth, and missing her scheduled medication pickup. Concern grew when her friend and colleague, Abbie Richardson, noticed her absence from the shelter and lack of communication. Further investigation revealed that Jayne, who had recently discussed a planned trip to a nearby desert with her brother, might have ventured there for some solitude, possibly underestimating the isolation in the area. Her family feared she might have gotten disoriented due to her disability. Police launched an operation finding her safely before preemptive health issues arose, traced back in Edinburgh.

Jayne, who had a history of wandering due to her condition, had mentioned wanting to visit a place she loved, 37-39 York Place, Perth. Jayne was later safely traced back to her home by staff who found her calmly sitting in the garden, having forgotten to notify others of her whereabouts and returning home on her own.
